item.title: Biden and Xi to speak after rare U.S. security adviser trip to China
item.description: The announcement came amid U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan's trip to Beijing this week to meet with Wang Yi, China's top diplomat.

item.title: 'She can go to hell': Vance blasts Kamala Harris over Afghanistan withdrawal in harshest rhetoric yet - NBC News
item.description:
1. 'She can go to hell': Vance blasts Kamala Harris over Afghanistan withdrawal in harshest rhetoric yet  NBC News
  2. JD Vance defends Trump after cemetery incident, says Harris 'can go to hell'  CNN
  3. Dispute Grows Over Trump’s Arlington Cemetery Visit as Vance Says Harris Can ‘Go to Hell’  The Wall Street Journal
  4. JD Vance says Kamala Harris 'can go to hell' during Erie appearance  Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
  5. JD Vance claims Kamala Harris is running a 'copycat campaign' during stop in major swing state  Fox News

item.title: JD Vance’s donut shop disaster: 'Felt terrible ...', Trump's running mate breaks silence on viral cringe
item.description: Ohio Senator JD Vance addressed a viral incident at a Valdosta, Georgia donut shop, where his campaign stop became awkward and heavily criticized online. Vance attributed the mishap to the clerk's nervousness due to the large presence of Secret Service agents and media. He also mentioned potential changes to his campaign strategy to prevent similar issues.

item.title: Who is Fatemeh Mohajerani, Iran's first woman spokesperson
item.description: In a historic move, President Masoud Pezeshkian appointed Fatemeh Mohajerani as Iran's new government spokesperson, marking the first time a woman holds this position. Mohajerani, with a Doctorate in Business Administration, brings significant experience from previous roles in education and government. She joins other high-ranking women like Shina Ansari and Farzaneh Sadeq Malvajard.

item.title: 'If Elon Musk fails to ...': Brazil threatens to block X within 24 hours
item.description: Brazil's Supreme Federal Court asked Elon Musk to appoint a legal representative for his social media platform X within 24 hours or risk suspension in the country. This follows recent staff reductions in Brazil and ongoing disputes involving free speech, far-right accounts, and misinformation. X alleges coercion from Minister Alexandre de Moraes in this matter.

item.title: US elections 2024: JD Vance accuses Kamala Harris of running a 'copycat campaign', criticizes VP on policy shifts during Pennsylvania event
item.description: Ohio Senator JD Vance accused Vice President Kamala Harris of mimicking Donald Trump’s campaign, citing her shifts in policy on issues like electric vehicle mandates and fracking. He argued that her policies would hurt American truckers, while Harris’s campaign countered by emphasizing their differences on key issues such as abortion rights and tax policies.

item.title: Sex discrimination commissioner urges Labor to reverse decision excluding gender and sexuality census questions
item.description:
Anna Cody worries the Albanese government’s backflip could ‘strengthen the voices of discrimination’

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

The sex discrimination commissioner has called on the government to put gender and sexuality questions in the census, as the treasurer, Jim Chalmers, appeared to open the door to revise the controversial decision to exclude them.

On Thursday Anna Cody wrote to the government warning backtracking on a commitment to ask about gender and sexuality “carries serious implications for the health, wellbeing and general equality of LGBTIQA+ Australians and their families”.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s breaking news email

Continue reading...

item.title: Australia news live: Jacqui Lambie says state politics push is ‘over’; sex discrimination commissioner calls on Labor to reverse census backflip
item.description:
Follow today’s news headlines live

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Severe weather warnings are in place across southern parts of the country for strong winds, including Victoria and Tasmania.

Here’s a wrap of the warnings currently in place, according to the Bureau of Meteorology:

Victoria – a strong cold front is expected to reach Victoria later today, clearing to the east tomorrow morning. Locations which may be affected by the wild weather include Portland, Bacchus Marsh, Falls Creek, Mt Hotham, Mt Buller and Omeo.

For the Central, West and South Gippsland and East Gippsland areas, a warning for abnormally high tides is in place.

Tasmania – a strong cold front is also expected to reach Tasmania later today, crossing the state tomorrow morning. The entire state is covered by the severe weather warning.

New South Wales – north-westerly winds are forecast to strengthen later today as a strong cold front approaches from the west. Locations which may be affected include Wollongong, Nowra, Bowral, Batemans Bay, Katoomba and Goulburn.

Meanwhile, fire danger ratings for the greater Sydney and Illawarra have been downgraded to “moderate” today after reaching “high” yesterday.

Western Australia – gusty, showery conditions are expected over parts of the South West Land Division today.

Continue reading...

item.title: U.N. nuclear watchdog warns of danger as Russia batters Ukraine with airstrikes
